original_title: Tere Ghar Me Ganga Behti Hai
overview: An orphan, Sarthak, is raised by a couple. As he grows up, Sarthak, along with two friends, raises awareness about serving parents across India and launches a massive campaign to celebrate February 14th as "Parents' Day." He meets with ministers, chief ministers, and officials to gain national recognition for this day.
title: Tere Ghar Me Ganga Behti Hai

overview: A super heart-touching story based on true events revolving around Diwali and the life of a poor family. The film beautifully portrays the essence of Diwali beyond materialistic celebrations, highlighting values of compassion, kindness, and selflessness through the lens of Asharamji's teachings and his connection with the underprivileged.
title: Sachchi Diwali | Short Film

overview:
25 December | Mystery of Christmas & Tulsi Pujan Day
A mysterious and thought-provoking story based on school children and the cultural environment around them.
How modern celebrations, social influence, and changing traditions affect young minds.
The story highlights the contrast between Western influence and Indian values, leading to awareness through Tulsi Pujan Day—a message of culture, balance, and moral growth for the next generation.

A story that makes children think, observe, and understand their roots.
title: 25 December wali story | Short Film
